sense.name: an agenda or procedure for executing a plan
sense.examples: Mary has a very hectic schedule to keep up with at work. The manufacturer is behind schedule with this month's factory orders. The schedule for making the launch to Mars cannot be altered by even one day. Bob has come up with a tentative schedule for completing this project by year's end.

sense.name: a published timetable
sense.examples: The bus schedule says the next bus leaves at 1:35. The airline publishes a new flight schedule four times a year. I discovered my train schedule was out of date.

sense.name: a calendar of events
sense.examples: Let's send each other copies of our schedules so we can coordinate when to meet. The fall schedule of classes is posted on the college's website. I don't see John's talk on the conference schedule of events.

sense.name: one of different forms to fill out on income tax returns
sense.examples: Do you have all the schedules you need to fill out your 2007 tax forms? The schedule I'm missing is not Schedule A.

sense.name: an appendix to a legal document
sense.examples: You will find the tables in a schedule at the end of the legal brief. The attorney's assistant prepared the schedules that were included in the client's will.
